name: BEACH Program Site-Channelized stream
description: The process of straightening or redirecting natural streams in an artificially modified or constructed stream bed. Channelization has been carried out for numerous reasons, most often to drain wetlands , direct water flow for agricultural use, and control flooding . While this process makes a stream more useful for human activities, it tends to interfere with natural river habitats and to destabilize stream banks by destroying riparian vegetation.

name: BEACH Program Site-Estuary
description: a partially enclosed coastal body of brackish water with one or more rivers or streams flowing into it, and with a free connection to the open sea Estuaries form a transition zone between river environments and maritime environments.  The sea water entering the estuary is diluted by the fresh water flowing from rivers and streams.

name: Canal Drainage
description: As a channel drainage system it is designed to eliminate the need for further pipework systems to be installed in parallel to the drainage, reducing the environmental impact of production as well as improving water collection.

name: Canal Irrigation
description: Irrigation canals are the main waterways that bring irrigation water from a water source to the areas to be irrigated. They can be lined with concrete, brick, stone, or a flexible membrane to prevent seepage and erosion.

name: Canal Transport
description: Canals are human-made channels for water conveyance, or to service water transport vehicles. In most cases, the engineered works will have a series of dams and locks that create areas of low speed current flow. These areas are referred to as slack water levels, often just called levels.

name: Channelized Stream
description: The process of straightening or redirecting natural streams in an artificially modified or constructed stream bed. Channelization has been carried out for numerous reasons, most often to drain wetlands , direct water flow for agricultural use, and control flooding . While this process makes a stream more useful for human activities, it tends to interfere with natural river habitats and to destabilize stream banks by destroying riparian vegetation.

name: Constructed Wetland
description: A constructed wetland (CW) is an artificial wetland to treat municipal or industrial wastewater, greywater or stormwater runoff. It may also be designed for land reclamation after mining, or as a mitigation step for natural areas lost to land development.Constructed wetlands are engineered systems that use natural functions vegetation, soil, and organisms to treat wastewater

name: Estuary
description: a partially enclosed coastal body of brackish water with one or more rivers or streams flowing into it, and with a free connection to the open sea Estuaries form a transition zone between river environments and maritime environments.  The sea water entering the estuary is diluted by the fresh water flowing from rivers and streams.

name: Floodwater non-Urban
description: A flood is an overflow of water that submerges land that is usually dry  Flooding may occur as an overflow of water from water bodies, such as a river, lake, or ocean, in which the water overtops or breaks levees, resulting in some of that water escaping its usual boundaries

name: Floodwater Urban
description: A flood is an overflow of water that submerges land that is usually dry  In the sense of "urban runoff water". it may occur due to an accumulation of rainwater on saturated ground in an areal flood.

name: Sump
description: A sump is a shallow borehole (no well construction) that intersects the water table

name: Wetland Estuarine-Ditch
description: Open water estuary, bay, sound Vegetated and non-vegetated brackish and saltwater ditch

name: Wetland Estuarine-Emergent
description: Open water estuary, bay, sound Herbaceous marsh, fen, swale and wet meadow

name: Wetland Estuarine-Forested
description: Open water estuary, bay, sound Vegetated brackish and saltwater forest

name: Wetland Estuarine-Marsh
description: Open water estuary, bay, sound Vegetated brackish and saltwater marsh

name: Wetland Estuarine-Pool
description: Open water estuary, bay, sound Vegetated brackish and saltwater pool: lagoons

name: Wetland Estuarine-Scrub-Shrub
description: Open water estuary, bay, sound Vegetated brackish and saltwater scrub-shrub

name: Wetland Estuarine-Tidal Creek
description: Open water estuary, bay, sound Vegetated brackish and saltwater tidal creek

name: Wetland Lacustrine-Emergent
description: bounded by upland or by wetland dominated by trees, shrubs, persistent emergents, emergent mosses, or lichens

name: Wetland Palustrine Pond
description: includes all nontidal wetlands dominated by pond and all such wetlands that occur in tidal areas where salinity due to ocean-derived salts is below 0.5 ‰

name: Wetland Palustrine-Emergent
description: includes all nontidal wetlands characterized by erect, rooted, herbaceous hydrophytes, excluding mosses and lichens and all such wetlands that occur in tidal areas where salinity due to ocean-derived salts is below 0.5 ‰

name: Wetland Palustrine-Forested
description: includes all nontidal wetlands dominated by trees, forest, and all such wetlands that occur in tidal areas where salinity due to ocean-derived salts is below 0.5 ‰

name: Wetland Palustrine-Moss-Lichen
description: includes all nontidal wetlands dominated by mosses or lichens, and all such wetlands that occur in tidal areas where salinity due to ocean-derived salts is below 0.5 ‰

name: Wetland Palustrine-Shrub-Scrub
description: includes all nontidal wetlands dominated by, shrubs, scrub and all such wetlands that occur in tidal areas where salinity due to ocean-derived salts is below 0.5 ‰

name: Wetland Riverine-Emergent
description: wetlands connected by rivers. ... They are found along the edges of rivers, streams and creeks and include rivers, floodplains, marshes, lakes and billabongs. characterized by erect, rooted, herbaceous hydrophytes, excluding mosses and lichens

name: Wetland Undifferentiated
description: a land area that is saturated with water, either permanently or seasonally, It primarily is characteristized by vegetation of aquatic plants, adapted to the unique hydric soil.
